page.title: 20Uffington C.E.School
page.content: Uffington School was built in 1848 by The Earl of Lindsey. Recently an extension of cloakroom and toilets was built and two mobile classrooms were sited in the play ground. The school uses an adjacent playing field. There are 43 pupils aged 4-11 years with two full time and one part time teacher. A secretary comes in for 7 hours each week and she shares lunch times super- vision with the caretaker.All children bring packed lunches as no hot meals are provided.Twelve children are trans ported from Tallington.The adjoining school house used to be occupied by the Headmistress but it is now rented by a Stamford teacher.Parents are en- couraged to help out and close contact is kept with the church.The Rector regularly visits school and the child- ren take part in church services and perform a concert there each Christmas
